text: I'm Matt gross the frugal traveler for
the New York time a year ago when my
daughter sasha was born my life changed
completely ok it didn't change that much
when sasha was just six weeks old my
wife and I took her to Italy since then
we've learned a lot and when I took
Sasha to San Francisco all alone I put
it all into practice
there wasn't too much for one dad
actually not too hard first I haven't
had to deal with any rough pavement yet
haven't had to turn any corners or deal
with any stairs or escalated as the
countdown to take off continued the goal
was of course sleep the more I tired her
out to better the flight would be for me
for Sasha and for everybody else
despite early success for the nap good
things always come to an end compliments
the challenging diaper change we both
survived and so did everyone else around
some parents find public transport
daunting especially with a stroller we
gave the bar to try 45 minutes later it
landed us in the Mission District right
near our temporary home we found this
gorgeous victorian house through airbnb
com just ninety dollars a night it had
everything we needed a huge bedroom a
full-featured kitchen and some
dangerously steep stairs for Sasha to
play on as we settled in I unpacked
three unusual affordable bits of baby
gear i always bring the peapod costs
about sixty dollars sorry Sasha no
getting up and wandering around at 2am I
don't know how much this maybe twenty
bucks but it's worth every finally
Sasha's portable hygiene which I got in
Italy last year for about 30 euros
here we go
too often the rain trapped us inside so
we played computer games and we read
books and when the Sun came out we pack
the diaper bag and hit the streets
finally San Francisco for real
wow this is the easiest way to get
around pushing a stroller in this city
is a bit tough with all the hills so
strap Sasha into the ergo baby carrier
and off we go we also took public
transit no taxis for us it takes some
patience and some planning traveling
with a toddler can be done and can even
be fun but it can be tiring too and not
just for the base for the New York Times
this is matt gross the frugal traveler
